summary.title: Banking API
summary.description: The system modeled is a Banking RESTful API that enables clients (mobile apps and third-party fintech partners) to perform banking operations such as checking balances, initiating transfers, and retrieving statements. All communication occurs via HTTPS, with clients authenticated through tokens or certificates. The API interacts with internal banking systems like the account management system, transaction engine, and database.

threats.title: Altering transfer amounts in transit.
threats.description: Intercepting and modifying API requests or responses.
threats.mitigation: Enforce HTTPS/TLS 1.3 and HMAC validation of payloads.

threats.title: DDoS on /transfer or /balance endpoints.
threats.description: Attackers flood API with requests, degrading performance.
threats.mitigation: Implement rate limiting,  and API Gateway throttling.

threats.title: Unauthorized user accessing other customersâ€™ accounts.
threats.description: Exploiting flawed access control to gain admin privileges.
threats.mitigation: Enforce strict role-based access control and least privilege

threats.title: Lack of sufficient logging for non-repudiation.
threats.mitigation: Enable secure audit logging with timestamps and user IDs.

threats.title: Account balances leaked through misconfigured API endpoint.
threats.description: Sensitive data exposed via insecure endpoints or verbose error messages.
threats.mitigation: Use input/output validation, disable verbose errors, and encrypt data at rest.

threats.title: Token Theft
threats.description: Attackers impersonate legitimate clients by stealing tokens or certificates.
